com.amazonaws.mobile.downloader-com.amazon.mysampleapp
com.mysampleapp.fileprovider
Home Item Detail Item List @string/app_name SIGN IN SIGN OUT
\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020\u0020 No Content Viewer No Viewing App exists for content type \'%s\'.
Overview Sample App Features User Sign-in Let your users sign in with public identity providers or your own identity system. Whether your users sign in or not, the User sign-in feature configures Amazon Cognito to uniquely identify the user and provide your app the appropriate credentials to access your AWS resources. The Sample App demonstrates assignment of a unique identifier for the user, the Amazon Cognito User ID. If optional or mandatory User Sign-in has been enabled in your project, then the Sample App also includes a sign-in screen, with a button for each configured sign-in provider. Powered by Amazon Cognito Demo User Identity User Data Storage Store files for your users in the cloud.\nStore and sync user data in key/value pairs. Store user files such as photos in the cloud. Save user data in key/value pairs and sync across devices that are signed-in with the same user. The Sample App demonstrates User File Storage and User Profile Data. The User File Storage demonstration includes a remote file explorer, which allows you to upload and download files from your Amazon S3 bucket. You will have access to four folders, a public folder where files are accessible to all users, a private folder where files are only accessible by the current app user, a protected folder where files are read-only to all users but only the owner of the folder can add or delete files, and the uploads folder which is write-only for all users.\n\nThe User Profile Data demonstration stores an app color theme using Amazon Cognito Sync and synchronizes that data across all of the user\'s devices as key/value pairs. Powered by Amazon Cognito and Amazon S3 Demo User File Storage Demo User Profile Data Cloud Logic Run business logic in the cloud without managing servers. Integrate functionality with your app using APIs. Run business logic in the cloud without managing servers. Integrate functionality with your app using APIs. The Sample App demonstrates the ability of a mobile app to invoke a REST API in Amazon API Gateway. Select the HTTP method, API endpoint, and resource path. Edit the body of the request. Invoke the API and see results. Powered by Amazon API Gateway and AWS Lambda Demo Cloud Logic APIs Pick an API you want to demo Path API Endpoint Path Method Query String Parameters Request Body Response Invoke Status : Latency : Reset
User Identity Keep track of users Displays the user identity. User Files Store and access files for your users. PUBLIC PRIVATE PROTECTED UPLOADS Private user file storage is only available to users who are signed-in.\n\nWould you like to sign in? Failed to delete item due to \'%s\'. Failed to download item due to \'%s\'. Failed to upload file due to \'%s\'. File upload completed successfully for \'%s\'. Cloud Logic User Profile Data Please wait … Loading… Please choose a theme: NoSQL Database Store data in the cloud. Store data in the cloud. The Sample App demonstrates how to access your configured Amazon DynamoDB NoSQL database tables. Select your table, insert sample data, and perform queries by choosing from a list of examples. Hold down an item in query results to update or delete the item. When you\'re done with the demo, you can remove the sample data from your table. Powered by Amazon DynamoDB
